name: Borobudur Temple
description: A magnificent 9th-century Buddhist temple and UNESCO World Heritage Site. Famous for its stunning sunrise views and ancient stone carvings.
address: Jl. Badrawati, Kw. Candi Borobudur, Borobudur, Magelang, Central Java 56553, Indonesia

name: Tanah Lot Temple
description: An iconic Hindu temple perched on a rocky outcrop in the sea. Best known for spectacular sunset views and traditional Balinese architecture.
address: Beraban, Kediri, Tabanan Regency, Bali 82121, Indonesia

name: Komodo National Park
description: Home to the legendary Komodo dragons, the world's largest living lizards. Features pristine beaches, coral reefs, and diverse marine life.
address: West Manggarai Regency, East Nusa Tenggara, Indonesia

name: Raja Ampat Islands
description: Known as the 'Four Kings', this marine paradise offers the world's richest underwater biodiversity. Perfect for diving and snorkeling enthusiasts.
address: Raja Ampat Regency, Southwest Papua, Indonesia

name: Sacred Monkey Forest Sanctuary
description: A nature reserve and Hindu temple complex in Ubud, home to hundreds of long-tailed macaques. Features ancient temples and lush tropical forest.
address: Jl. Monkey Forest Rd, Ubud, Gianyar Regency, Bali 80571, Indonesia
